answers.answer: Water should be fine. When ever I have had tests in the past that have required fasting it usually means no eating or drinking anything besides water. They dont want to dehydrate you. Just starve, lol:)

Okay phew! I was like not eating...no problem! But as soon as I go to bed I wake up every 2 hours to pee and I'm always sooo thirsty! So that makes me feel better. Just water, I can handle that. Thanks!

I understand fasting to mean that you cannot eat or drink anything. When I had my 3-hour glucose test I was required to fast and I was not allowed to drink water until halfway through the testing.It might affect your test results, but I'm not sure!
when i had my glucose 3 hr and my second 1 hr  one both times the nurse told me not to have anything even water until afterwards sooo hmm im sure ..but good luck

Well, i dont believe that you are having a glucose test... so unless your doctor specifically mentioned "no water" i would have to say that water is fine.  they definately dont want you dehydrated... that can be REALLLY bad for a pregnant woman to be dehydrated.  there is no way they meant no water... so go for it!

I've always been told that fasting means no food or drink...But i just googled it and found where several people and supposed doctors have said that plain black coffee and water are ok.  The point of fasting is so you don't have anything in your stomach that can affect your blood values...which means nothing that has calories, sugar or anything else.  So while I wouldn't drink tons of  water...a little bit here and there to wet the whistle so to speak, I don't think will affect anything.  BUT even if you don't drink any water....you're not going to dehydrate in 7-8 hours.  Not unless you are severely vomiting and having diarhhea.  We sleep 8 or more hours with no fluids...

I always understood that if you are having testing done, then it's NO food OR beverage. (Including water.) I would call your doctor and ask... Sorry for the bad news, but I am pretty sure you can't have anything to drink or eat! =(Good luck!

Well I just got back and found out water was OK...thank god! And when I sleep I don't' go 8 hours without drinking..I wake up every 2 so damn thirsty...so I just tried to sip water throughout the night. But I woke up feeling so dehydrated and I didn't want that to happen so I didn't drink a lot, but just enough to keep me going. I go to get my blood done and they took 18 TUBES of blood from me! HOLY HELL, I thought I was going to pass out! Finally after 13 tubes my left arm gave out and they had to use my other arm! It was crazy!!! So glad thats over with!Thanks for the advice ladies! Now I'm gonna try and scan my U/S pic!

Maybe you should get checked for diabetes. (Or maybe 1 of those 18 tubes is for that) I say that cause diabetes runs in my family, and excessive thirst is one of the symptoms of it.  Or maybe your excessive thirst is just pregnancy related.Anyway, best of luck to you. :-D

question: I'm having some testing tomorrow....I'm really anemic so my doctor is testing me for a bunch of things...hemaglobin, protein S, protein C, lupus etc. She said its all normal testing because she just wants to make sure all of that is normal since I've had 2 M/C's in a row. So I'm not worried at all but she did mention that I have to fast after midnight. Now I know that means no eating, but can I drink water? I get SOOO thirsty! At night and ALL throughout the night! I plan on going to get my blood tested very early in the am but still how am I going to last 7-8 hours without water?? Help!
title: One more quick question!
